entry.title: Hôtel Albert Ciamberlani (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the façade of Hôtel Albert Ciamberlani (pictured) has been described as one of the most beautiful Art Nouveau façades in Belgium?

entry.title: Muchlis Ibrahim (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Muchlis Ibrahim opted to resign as Governor of West Sumatra when Zainal Bakar, instead of his choice, was appointed to be his deputy?

entry.title: a radio station in Illinois (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that even though an FCC examiner recommended denial of an application for a radio station in Illinois after approving it twice, the commission granted it anyway?

entry.title: Montagu Toller (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Montagu Toller was a part of the British team that played cricket at the 1900 Summer Olympics, the only time cricket was ever featured at the Olympics?

entry.title: Just Like a Woman (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that covers of Bob Dylan's "Just Like a Woman" by Manfred Mann and Jonathan King were both coincidentally released on the same day Dylan was involved in a motorcycle accident?

entry.title: Cut Meutia (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Cut Meutia is the only active train service in Indonesia using standard-gauge track?

entry.title: School for American Crafts (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the School for American Crafts recruited faculty from Denmark to teach metalsmithing and woodworking?

entry.title: 31-day continuous livestream (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Ludwig Ahgren showered on camera during his 31-day continuous livestream?
